attributes.action: abandon the use of the title 'honourable' when referring to members of parliament until they have demonstrated that they are worthy of being described as such
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Recent revelations in the media of MPs and Cabinet Members expenses claims show that while these may be within the letter of the guidance, they are clearly not the actions of honourable men and women.  It is therefore suggested that no MP should be referred to as 'honourable' if there is any doubt whatsoever as to the morality, justification and indeed honourability of their conduct.

rejection.details: This is a matter for Parliament: http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
